title: Drawing, "King's Costume Design, for Checkmate", 1937
medium: Brush and gouache, graphite on white paper
signed: Signed in black ink, lower right: E. Mcknight Kauffer
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, upper right: back-half cape; pointing to crown, right: round; pointing to skirt, right: part of the skirt / goes round half in back; pointing to cape, lower left: cape- part of breast fold / starting from right / hand shoulder-- / e[...] straight on / Discs and belt of / brass - anyway / very bright-light / c[...]; in black ink, lower right: King--"Checkmate"
creditline: Gift of Mrs. E. McKnight Kauffer
description: Design for king’s costume in red and orange. The king, with gray shoulder-length hair and beard, stands frontally with arms open at either side. He wears a crown topped with a cross, his dress has slim silhouette with a cape attached by two gold discs at shoulders and a wide gold belt. Sketch of the back of the costume in graphite, upper right.
